meanings.definition: A hand of cards containing no card above nine.
meanings.sent1: During the card game, I was dealt a yarborough with only low cards.
meanings.sent2: In bridge, having a yarborough can make it challenging to win tricks.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't believe my luck when I got a yarborough hand - it was almost too easy!
meanings.sent4: Her hand was like a yarborough, filled with humble cards that held no power.
meanings.sent5: The yarborough hand was so weak, it felt like holding a handful of feathers.

meanings.definition: A bridge hand containing no card above nine.
meanings.sent1: The player's yarborough in bridge made it difficult to strategize effectively.
meanings.sent2: Having a yarborough in bridge can sometimes be a disadvantage.
meanings.sent3: His yarborough hand was like a puzzle with missing pieces - hard to complete.
meanings.sent4: The yarborough hand was a barren land, devoid of any high-ranking cards.
meanings.sent5: Trying to win with a yarborough hand felt like climbing a mountain without gear.

meanings.definition: A yarborough is a hand of cards that contains no card higher than a nine.
meanings.sent1: During the game, I was surprised to see a yarborough in my hand.
meanings.sent2: The yarborough hand was a rare occurrence but not impossible.
meanings.sent3: Getting a yarborough felt like finding a four-leaf clover - lucky!
meanings.sent4: Her yarborough hand was a hidden gem among the usual high cards.
meanings.sent5: The yarborough hand was a gentle reminder of the simplicity of the game.
